baselayers.attribution: Powered by ESRI | ESRI, USGS, NOAA
baselayers.label: ESRI Topo

layer-groups-order.name: Reference and Boundaries
layer-groups-order.info: Ancillary reference data from external sources.

layer-groups-order.name: Annual Phenology Variables
layer-groups-order.info: Phenology variables describing changes in vegetation across the annual cycle, where the cycle begins at the start of the phenological year. The phenological year and all variables are derived from polar graphs of the vegetation index data. Mean values for 2000 - 2017 are shown; values for individual years are available.

layer-groups-order.name: Summary Phenology Variables
layer-groups-order.info: Summary variables describing over 95 percent of the variation in all of the phenology variables. Produced by factor analysis, a statistical method that reduces variation in many variables, some of which may be duplicative, to a few distinctive core components.

layer-groups-order.name: Phenological Classes (phenoclasses)
layer-groups-order.info: Classification of phenological types on the basis of similarities and differences in the phenology variables. Important biophysical and ecological gradients are reflected by their phenologies. Produced by cluster analysis on the four phenology factors—each 'phenoclass' has a unique combination of factor values. Similar phenoclasses have similar color on the basis of their characteristic factor values.

layer-groups-order.name: Phenological Change Metrics
layer-groups-order.info: Estimates of change within and across the 2000 - 2017 period. Year-to-year change in annual phenology can result from vegetation disturbance and recovery, responses to climate variability, land use change, and other factors. Metrics are calculated from the amount of year-to-year difference in each of the four phenology factors.

layer-groups-order.name: Landscape Information-Theoretic Metrics
layer-groups-order.info: Metrics for assessing the complexity, organization, and development of landscape dynamics over time. Derived from information theory, as applied in ecosystem ecology. Dynamics are measured as year-to-year changes in phenoclass for individual pixels, compiled across 25-pixel landscapes from 2000 to 2017. Each pixel has the metric value for the landscape that surrounds it.

layer-groups-order.name: Long-term Landscape Shift
layer-groups-order.info: Measures of long-term landscape stability (or instability) implied by the observed phenoclass dynamics. Dynamics are measured as year-to-year changes in phenoclass for individual pixels, compiled across 25-pixel landscapes from 2000 to 2017. These changes cumulatively result in landscape trajectories, for both the phenology variables and the information-theoretic metrics.

layer-groups-order.name: Landscape and Climate Characteristics
layer-groups-order.info: Ancillary data from external sources, for comparison with LanDAT metrics

carbon-models.name: Estimated carbon storage, 2000-2009
carbon-models.info: Carbon storage, estimated as total carbon density (metric tonnes per hectare) in all vegetation. USFS Forest Inventory and Analysis (FIA) program.

carbon-models.name: LanDAT carbon storage model
carbon-models.info: Carbon storage, estimated as total carbon density (metric tonnes per hectare) in all vegetation. LanDAT model using 2000-2015 MODIS data, trained on FIA estimates.

carbon-models.name: Landscape Shift in Carbon Storage
carbon-models.info: Long-term (decadal) expected gains and losses in carbon density, estimated from observed annual changes in LanDAT phenological variables.

boundaries.name: North American states and provinces (coarse)
boundaries.info: North American political boundaries from the Commission for Environmental Cooperation, a combined effort of the National Atlas program in Canada, the U.S. Geological Survey, and Mexico's Instituto Nacional de Estadística y Geografía.

boundaries.name: U.S. states (precise)
boundaries.info: U.S. state borders from the U.S. Census Bureau's TigerLine products

boundaries.name: Counties
boundaries.info: U.S. county borders from the U.S. Census Bureau's TigerLine products

ancillary.name: Land Cover, 2016
ancillary.info: Modified National Land Cover Database (NLCD) extended to North America, 2016

ancillary.name: Landscape Mosaic Pattern
ancillary.info: An index measuring the mixture of agricultural, developed, and semi-natural land cover types within 15-hectare (37-acre) neighborhoods. US Forest Service, based on the 2011 National Land Cover Database.

ancillary.name: Landscape Forest Density
ancillary.info: An index estimating the proportion of the landscape around a given forest area that is also forested, measured within 15-hectare (37-acre) neighborhoods. Low-density areas may be fragmented by non-forest land uses or natural non-forest cover. US Forest Service, based on the 2011 National Land Cover Database.

ancillary.name: Total Tree Basal Area
ancillary.info: Estimated total tree basal area. USFS Forest Health Technology Enterprise Team, 2012.

ancillary.name: Tree Basal Area at Risk from Insect and Disease Pathogens
ancillary.info: Percent of basal area estimated to be at risk. USFS Forest Health Technology Enterprise Team, 2012.

ancillary.name: Decline in Evergreen Vegetation, 2000-2011
ancillary.info: Rate of decline in the evergreen (non-deciduous) component of vegetation greenness (NDVI) from 2000 to 2011. Higher values indicate stronger decline.

ancillary.name: Housing Density, 2010
ancillary.info: Housing units per squ. km, by partial census block group. US Census Bureau and SILVIS Lab.

ancillary.name: Palmer Drought Severity Index, 2000-2015 Mean
ancillary.info: Self-calibrated drought index (scPDSI); mean monthly value, 2000-2015. Values below -0.5 indicate drier than normal.

ancillary.name: Palmer Drought Severity Index, 2000-2015 Variability
ancillary.info: Self-calibrated drought index (scPDSI); inter-annual variability, 2000-2015. Higher values indicate more year-to-year variation.

ancillary.name: Historical Fires from 2000 to 2018
ancillary.info: Shows locations and intensities of fires that occured from 2000 to 2016

ancillary.name: Historical Fires from 1984 to 1999
ancillary.info: Shows locations and intensities of fires that occured from 1984 to 1999

summary-phenology.name: Factor 1 - Timing
summary-phenology.info: Factors 1 and 2 are very closely associated with the day-of-year variables, and therefore represent aspects of timing across the annual cycle. Two factors are required to fully represent timing around the annual cycle in the two-dimensional polar graphs (each timing variable must be represented by its sine and cosine).

summary-phenology.name: Factor 2 - Timing
summary-phenology.info: Factors 1 and 2 are very closely associated with the day-of-year variables, and therefore represent aspects of timing across the annual cycle. Two factors are required to fully represent timing around the annual cycle in the two-dimensional polar graphs (each timing variable must be represented by its sine and cosine).

summary-phenology.name: Factor 3 - Seasonality
summary-phenology.info: Factor 3 is very closely related to variables representing seasonality and growing season length (which are themselves closely related). Lower factor 4 values correspond to stronger seasonality or deciduousness, and shorter growing seasons.

summary-phenology.name: Factor 4 - Productivity
summary-phenology.info: Factor 4 is very closely associated with NDVI greenness, and therefore also corresponds to the amount and productivity of vegetation.

it-metrics.name: Rate of Inter-annual Change
it-metrics.info: The proportion of inter-annual change events in which a change in phenoclass occurs (as opposed to phenoclass stability). An indicator of how dynamic a landscape is over the short term.

it-metrics.name: Shannon Entropy
it-metrics.info: Measures the total complexity, or diversity, of observed landscape dynamics. Higher values indicate a greater variety of transitions among different phenoclasses.

it-metrics.name: Mutual Information
it-metrics.info: Measures the component of overall complexity (Shannon Entropy) which is predictable or organized. Higher values indicate that given the phenoclass states in one year, it is easy to predict the states in the next year.

it-metrics.name: Conditional Entropy
it-metrics.info: Measures the component of overall complexity (Shannon Entropy) which is unpredictable, disorganized, or redundant. The complement of Mutual Information.

it-metrics.name: Development
it-metrics.info: Mutual Information standardized by Shannon Diversity: the proportion of the overall complexity which is organized and predictable. In other words, the degree of organization, given the amount of complexity present.

it-metrics.name: Capacity
it-metrics.info: Shannon Entropy scaled to productivity, by multiplying by mean NDVI. Measures the complexity of landscape dynamics, and overall productivity.

it-metrics.name: Ascendency
it-metrics.info: Mutual Information scaled to productivity, by multiplying by mean NDVI. Measures the predictability or organization of landscape dynamics, and overall productivity.

it-metrics.name: Overhead
it-metrics.info: Conditional Entropy scaled to productivity, by multiplying by mean NDVI. Measures the unpredictability or disorganization of landscape dynamics, and overall productivity.

phenology-variables.name: Mean Annual Greenness
phenology-variables.info: Mean vegetation index (NDVI) value across the phenological year.

phenology-variables.name: Mean Growing Season Greenness
phenology-variables.info: Mean vegetation index (NDVI) value within the growing season, i.e., between the beginning and end of growing season dates.

phenology-variables.name: Degree of Seasonality, or Deciduousness
phenology-variables.info: Dominance of NDVI greenness in one portion of the year, visible in polar graphs as 'off-centered' annual cycles. Measured by the length of the mean NDVI vector in polar graphs. More evergreen vegetation shows lower seasonality.

phenology-variables.name: Growing Season Greenness Variability
phenology-variables.info: Standard deviation of NDVI; a measure of variability in greenness among 8-day periods within the growing season.

phenology-variables.name: Growing Season Length
phenology-variables.info: Number of days between the beginning and end of growing season dates.

phenology-variables.name: Beginning of Growing Season
phenology-variables.info: Julian day of year when 15 percent of the total accumulated greenness for the phenological year has already occurred. Fifteen percent is an arbitrary benchmark, applied in a standard way across all places and years.

phenology-variables.name: Early Growing Season Center
phenology-variables.info: Julian day of year marking the 'center of mass' of NDVI values in the first half of the growing season. Measured by the direction of the mean NDVI vector between the start and middle of growing season dates.

phenology-variables.name: Early Growing Season Magnitude
phenology-variables.info: Dominance of greenness in the first half of the growing season. Measured by the length of the mean NDVI vector between the start and middle of growing season dates.

phenology-variables.name: Middle of Growing Season
phenology-variables.info: Julian day of year marking the middle of the growing season. Measured by the direction of the mean NDVI vector in polar graphs.

phenology-variables.name: Late Growing Season Center
phenology-variables.info: Julian day of year marking the 'center of mass' of NDVI values in the second half of the growing season. Measured by the direction of the mean NDVI vector between the middle and end of growing season dates.

phenology-variables.name: Late Growing Season Magnitude
phenology-variables.info: Dominance of greenness in the second half of the growing season. Measured by the length of the mean NDVI vector between the middle and end of growing season dates.

phenology-variables.name: End of Growing Season
phenology-variables.info: Julian day of year when 80 percent of the total accumulated greenness for the phenological year has already occurred. Eighty percent is an arbitrary benchmark, applied in a standard way across all places and years.

phenoclasses.info: Membership in one of 500 phenological classes, using data from all years
phenoclasses.name: 500 Phenoclasses, multi-annual
500 Phenoclasses, 2000
phenoclasses.info: Membership in one of 500 phenological classes, using data from a single phenological year.  (see polar graphs for explanation of the phenological year). Year to year phenoclass changes normally result from disturbance, recovery, and other changes in vegetation.

phenoclasses.name: 500 Phenoclasses, 2015
phenoclasses.info: Membership in one of 500 phenological classes, using data from a single phenological year.  (see polar graphs for explanation of the phenological year). Year to year phenoclass changes normally result from disturbance, recovery, and other changes in vegetation.

phenoclasses.name: 500 Phenoclasses, 2016
phenoclasses.info: Membership in one of 500 phenological classes, using data from a single phenological year.  (see polar graphs for explanation of the phenological year). Year to year phenoclass changes normally result from disturbance, recovery, and other changes in vegetation.

phenoclass-derived.name: Total Year-to-Year Path Length
phenoclass-derived.info: Total summed amount or 'length' of all annual changes. Estimates the cumulative variability, which may be large even if the final state is similar to the initial state.

phenoclass-derived.name: Final Between-years Distance
phenoclass-derived.info: Amount of difference between the first and last years. Analogous to a straight-line distance rather than the path length.

phenoclass-derived.name: Maximum Year-to-Year Step
phenoclass-derived.info: The single largest change observed between any two consecutive years.

phenoclass-derived.name: Mean Year-to-Year Step
phenoclass-derived.info: The mean change observed between consecutive years.

phenoclass-derived.name: Minimum Year-to-Year Step
phenoclass-derived.info: The smallest change observed between any two consecutive years.

phenoclass-derived.name: Maximum Between-years Distance
phenoclass-derived.info: The difference between the two most different years (the two years need not be consecutive).

phenoclass-derived.name: Mean Between-years Distance
phenoclass-derived.info: The mean difference between any two years, considering all possible year combinations.

phenoclass-derived.name: Minimum Between-years Distance
phenoclass-derived.info: The difference between the two most similar years (the two years need not be consecutive).

longtermlandshift.name: Landscape Compositional Shift
longtermlandshift.info: Gross measure of the degree of stability or instability of landscape dynamics. While short-term phenoclass dynamics may be strong (see Rate of Inter-annual Change, above), those changes may or may not result in long-term changes in overall phenoclass composition and phenological characteristics. Higher values indicate 'instability', that is, a strong trajectory of long-term change.

longtermlandshift.name: Growing Season Greenness Trajectory
longtermlandshift.info: Trajectory of change in Mean Growing Season Greenness at the landscape scale, implied by the observed phenoclass dynamics.

longtermlandshift.name: Seasonality Trajectory
longtermlandshift.info: Trajectory of change in Seasonality at the landscape scale, implied by the observed phenoclass dynamics.

longtermlandshift.name: Growing Season Length Trajectory
longtermlandshift.info: Trajectory of change in Growing Season Length at the landscape scale, implied by the observed phenoclass dynamics.

longtermlandshift.name: Middle of Growing Season Trajectory
longtermlandshift.info: Trajectory of change in the Middle of Growing Season date at the landscape scale, implied by the observed phenoclass dynamics.

longtermlandshift.name: Factor 1 Trajectory
longtermlandshift.info: Trajectory of change in Phenology Factor 1 (timing) at the landscape scale, implied by the observed phenoclass dynamics.

longtermlandshift.name: Factor 2 Trajectory
longtermlandshift.info: Trajectory of change in Phenology Factor 2 (timing) at the landscape scale, implied by the observed phenoclass dynamics.

longtermlandshift.name: Factor 3 Trajectory
longtermlandshift.info: Trajectory of change in Phenology Factor 3 (productivity) at the landscape scale, implied by the observed phenoclass dynamics.

longtermlandshift.name: Factor 4 Trajectory
longtermlandshift.info: Trajectory of change in Phenology Factor 4 (seasonality) at the landscape scale, implied by the observed phenoclass dynamics.

longtermlandshift.name: Shannon Entropy Trajectory
longtermlandshift.info: Trajectory of change in Shannon Entropy at the landscape scale, implied by the observed phenoclass dynamics.

longtermlandshift.name: Mutual Information Trajectory
longtermlandshift.info: Trajectory of change in Mutual Information at the landscape scale, implied by the observed phenoclass dynamics.

longtermlandshift.name: Conditional Entropy Trajectory
longtermlandshift.info: Trajectory of change in Conditional Entropy at the landscape scale, implied by the observed phenoclass dynamics.

longtermlandshift.name: Development Trajectory
longtermlandshift.info: Trajectory of change in Development at the landscape scale, implied by the observed phenoclass dynamics.

longtermlandshift.name: Capacity Trajectory
longtermlandshift.info: Trajectory of change in Capacity at the landscape scale, implied by the observed phenoclass dynamics.

longtermlandshift.name: Ascendency Trajectory
longtermlandshift.info: Trajectory of change in Ascendency at the landscape scale, implied by the observed phenoclass dynamics.

longtermlandshift.name: Overhead Trajectory
longtermlandshift.info: Trajectory of change in Overhead at the landscape scale, implied by the observed phenoclass dynamics.
